titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Western Teleplays Collection
titlestmt.author: by George Miles

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Sunday December 9, 2018 at 04:34
profiledesc.descrules: translation missing: en.enumerations.resource_finding_aid_description_rules.beinecke manuscript unit archival processing manual

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Collection contains 193 scripts for three popular network television shows: Bat Masterson, Gunsmoke, and Little House on the Prairie. There are 138 Bat Masterson scripts, 17 Gunsmoke scripts, and 38 Little House on the Prairie scripts. Many of the scripts have been heavily annotated; more than a dozen of the Bat Masterson episodes are represented by multiple drafts.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Ongoing collection of documents acquired by gift and purchase from various sources. The first accession, making up Series I, II, and III were purchased from Walter Reuben in 1987 and 1988. Second accession of interfiled Bat Masterson filmscripts were pruchased from Walter Reuben in 2005.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Western Teleplays Collection is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Western Teleplays Collection. Yale Collection of Western Americana, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Western Teleplays Collection contains 193 scripts for three popular network television shows: Bat Masterson , Gunsmoke , and Little House on the Prairie . The scripts have been organized into series by show.

Series I, Bat Masterson
contains 138 scripts from 1958-1961. They have been organized by episode number which ranges from 1B through 107B. More than a dozen episodes are represented by multiple drafts, but there are no scripts present for episodes 35B, 72B, 74B or 95B. The scripts for nearly every episode contain revised pages (which typically include the date of their revision), and many of the scripts are heavily annotated "cutting scripts" which reflect the final editing of the episode before it was broadcast.

Series II, Gunsmoke
, consists of seventeen scripts from 1966-1975. The bulk of the scripts are dated between July 1973 and February 1975. As the Gunsmoke scripts do not include an episode number, they have been organized by date of last noted revision.

Series III, Little House on the Prairie
, contains scripts for thirty-eight episodes from 1974-1982. The first thirty-three scripts are arranged by episode numbers. The earliest numbered episode is #3 which is dated July 8, 1974. The bulk of the series falls between episode #59 (April 30, 1976) and episode #200 (January 7, 1982). Five unnumbered and undated scripts for Little House on the Prairie episodes are arranged alphabetically by title after the numbered episodes.

The box and folder list which follows includes the title of each episode (including earlier versions where so indicated on the script), the date of the final noted revisions for each script, the kind of script represented (e.g. draft, revised draft, cutting, etc.), and the names of any writers, directors, and producers that were identified in the script.

controlaccess.title: Bat Masterson (Television program)
Gunsmoke (Television program)
Little house on the prairie (Television program)
controlaccess.subject: Western television programs
